snippet.textDisplay: These two jokes supported sotnikova who double footed a landing, couldn't perform a lutz on the outside edge (just like lipinski), and prerotated and under rotated every single jump over Yuna who skated 2 near perfect programs in sochi. They have NO ROOM to be furious over anything. They're both jokes in the skating world.

snippet.textDisplay: I think as commentators, Tara and Johnny should have done their jobs and not taken this so personal.  I think they were wrong.  Maybe there is a clause in their contract that says they can OPT OUT if a skater had  a bad drug test or they simply dont like what country theyre from?    idk.

snippet.textDisplay: Neither Tara nor Johnny took personal issue with Kamila. They disagreed with an athlete with a positive drug test being permitted to skate. Their actions were professional as they acknowledged she skated. No disparaging remarks were made against Kamila.

snippet.textDisplay: Lipinski and Weir arent opposers of Valieva. They are former elite competitive skaters and professional skating commentators credibly speaking about the impact this doped skater is having on the sport and these entire games. The IOC which should be concerned about the health dangers of their condoning doped skating- 'and should have sent her home to be monitored by a doctor - isn't responsibly adhering to its own motto. All of this makes the broadcasting of this Olympic short program very hard - for everyne but doping caught (again) Russia.
snippet.textOriginal: Lipinski and Weir arent opposers of Valieva. All of this makes the broadcasting of this Olympic short program very hard - for everyne but doping caught (again) Russia.

snippet.textDisplay: The IOC suspended her, as did the Russian anti-doping agency (RUSADA).  That's something that everyone is overlooking or misunderstanding, including Lipinski and Weir.  It was the CAS (Court of Arbitration for Sports) who ruled that she could compete, overruling both the IOC and the RUSADA.  So the IOC nor RUSADA are to blame.  They tried to suspend her but they were overruled.
snippet.textOriginal: The IOC suspended her, as did the Russian anti-doping agency (RUSADA).  That's something that everyone is overlooking or misunderstanding, including Lipinski and Weir.
